title: Importar configuraciones, marcadores, etc. Entre Firefox Mac y Firefox Pc Windows
content:
Holas, Tratare de explicarme lo mejor posible.

Desde hace algunos años, he estado sincronizando 'ocasionalmente' mi Firefox de escritorio (Mac) y mi móvil Android. Pienso que si se han estado sincronizando, pues he visto algunos sitios en el móvil donde acceso de inmediato (tendrán ya el pass y la dirección). En ese sentido, yo usaba mucho mas Firefox de escritorio. Mi Mac se dañó de forma irrecuperable. Solo tuve tiempo de copiar algunos folders de la Mac y varios programas entre esos, Firefox a un disco externo.

Ahora, estoy "reimportando todo" de a poco en una laptop Pc Windows. Deseo ver como salvar toda la configuración de Firefox de la Mac en esta laptop Pc. Pienso que podría ser de 3 formas?

1- Instalar Firefox en la laptop Pc e intentar "enviar" la sincronización desde mi móvil, para ver qué marcadores y configuración se sincronizó y se salvó? Como se hace eso? Favor explicármelo paso a paso.

2- Ubicar en cual folder del sistema Mac, Firefox guarda el archivo de la configuración y yo lo importo al folder de Firefox en la laptop Pc? Yo podría revisar si logre copiar (y quizá tenga) ese folder y pueda salvar la mas reciente configuración. Si también se pueda hacer así, favor explicármelo paso a paso.

3- Alguna otra forma que no he visto?

cual de esas formas seria la mejor para intentar recuperar la mas actual configuración?

Aprecio cualquier ayuda y guía en como hacerlo. Gracias.
creator: maciasimagenes

title: History is fine, passwords are fine, but bookmarks are all gone
content: Hello, and apologies in advance if I am missing something that would easily solve this problem. The other day, I was trying to open Firefox like normal and noticed my 100+ tabs were all gone. It was tough since I needed many of those for work and academic purposes, and couldn't seem to recover the window properly without having to manually click through history to get every tab back. I worked on getting these back for about an hour, and couldnt get every tab back in its entirety, unfortunately. I looked through these forums and Reddit for solutions and kept seeing that a fresh reinstall could help, so I did so. I kept getting a message saying that I had an "old version", so maybe I accidentally got an old version. I couldn't avoid the error, so I did an uninstall via Window's uninstall panel in settings. When I opened the new install of Firefox back up, all of my bookmarks are completely gone, all 11,000+ of them, in fact. Again, a lot of these are needed for future work purposes, so it's a bit frustrating that its all just kinda...gone. I tried finding backups, but the latest ones are from the reinstall, 9/13/24. I can't find a profile either that has the previous bookmarks, which is worrisome. I tried logging into Firefox on my phone- same deal. However, my history is intact, as well as all of my saved autofill passwords. I can't find old profiles from that old install (that I assume were deleted with that uninstall. Probably should have been more careful before that, since I got the impression sync would work, lol) that aren't before 9/13. I tried syncing in settings, logging in and out of my sync profile that I've had since I first got Firefox on my computer. Is there anything I can do about this? How come the bookmarks are all gone, yet the rest is just fine?
creator: muirmagic

title: SafeShop
content:
Iba consultar una duda y he encontrado la solución por mi cuenta, que pongo aquí por si acaso a alguien más le pasa. Llevaba un tiempo notando que en los resultados de Google salía Safeshop Verified, encima del nombre de las páginas en el resultado. Una app (Safeshop) para Chrome que nunca había instalado en Firefox, así pasé el antivirus por si acaso, que dio un resultado limpio.

En modo de resolución de problemas dicha "app" no aparecía, así que pensando decidí apagar todas las apps, y como al hacerlo no aparecía, concluí que era una de ellas la que tenía el "regalito no pedido". Así fue, es la app AnonymoX, tras la última actualización decidió añadir Safeshop, algo de lo que ya se han quejado varios usuarios de la app. Así que si a alguien le sale eso y tiene la app, ya sabe de donde viene.

title: translator
content:
We make a web application and some customers had problems caused by the Firefox translator. Specifically it translates the content of hidden input fields like this: <input name="ACTION" id="ACTION" type="hidden" value="login" translate="no" data-translate="false"/> causing the application to not work anymore. (the translator changed the word "login" to "login in und in").

Note the 2 attributes I have added in the html, which DON'T prevent translation.

The input field is inside this block: <body class="notranslate">

class="notranslate" seems to prevent translation of the various labels inside the body, but NOT of the value of the hidden input field.

As it is a multilanguage application (the users can change the language inside the application), I would like to entirely disable translation by the browser for this web site. Can this be done using certain tags or attributes? At least I would like that the content of input fields is not modified by the translator. Is that possible?

title: Mozilla Firefox fica sem som/mudo automaticamente sempre que abro qualquer outro app no desktop
content:
Eu uso WINDOWS 10 e estou tendo o problema do ""firefox ficando sem som toda vez que aciono algum outro app no computador"" ou alguma outra mídia com som. Esse problema até é reversível: basta ir em Configurações de som/Volume do app e preferências do dispositivo e tirar o firefox do "mudo". No entanto, esse problema persiste, e continua ocorrendo, tornando-se necessário reverter isso toda a vez que abro algum outro app no computador.

Talvez o problema seja com configurações/atualizações do windows mais recente, mas de qualquer forma, só estou tendo esse problema com o firefox.
